fullDescription.text: An object A expects an object B to have been used correctly (CrySL blocks REQUIRES and ENSURES). For example a Cipher object requires a SecretKey object to be correctly and securely generated.
A constraint of a CrySL rule is violated, e.g., a key is generated with the wrong key size.
An object A expects an object B to have been used correctly (CrySL blocks REQUIRES and ENSURES). For example a Cipher object requires a SecretKey object to be correctly and securely generated.
A constraint of a CrySL rule is violated, e.g., a key is generated with the wrong key size.

message.text: First parameter was not properly generated as prepared Key Material.
message.richText: RequiredPredicateError violating CrySL rule for javax.crypto.spec.SecretKeySpec.

message.text: Second parameter (with value "DESede") should be any of {AES, HmacSHA224, HmacSHA256, HmacSHA384, HmacSHA512}.
message.richText: ConstraintError violating CrySL rule for javax.crypto.spec.SecretKeySpec.

message.text: First parameter (with value "DESede") should be any of {AES, PBEWithHmacSHA224AndAES_128, PBEWithHmacSHA256AndAES_128, PBEWithHmacSHA384AndAES_128, PBEWithHmacSHA512AndAES_128, PBEWithHmacSHA224AndAES_256, PBEWithHmacSHA256AndAES_256, PBEWithHmacSHA384AndAES_256, PBEWithHmacSHA512AndAES_256}.
message.richText: ConstraintError violating CrySL rule for javax.crypto.Cipher.

message.text: Second parameter was not properly generated as generated Key.
message.richText: RequiredPredicateError violating CrySL rule for javax.crypto.Cipher.
